description: vile +‎ -ity, from Latin vīlitās: compare French vileté, Middle French vilité, Old French vilté.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The quality of being vile or base.
examples: The Comedians wore these to represent the vility of the Persons they represented; as debauch'd young Sparks, old crazy Misers, Pimps, Parasites, Strumpets, and the rest of that Gang.
